uk.uncodedstudios.uncode2d.animation

Class Frame2

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.uncodedstudios.uncode2d.animation.Frame2

  • public class Frame2
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to store information about a 2D Frame animation.
    Version:
    1.0 - 2013-04-13
    Author:
    Figglewatts

    • Constructor Detail

      • Frame2

        public Frame2(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle firstFrame,
      int frames)
        Creates a frame animation.
        Parameters:
        firstFrame - A Rectangle which details the size and position of the first frame.
        frames - The amount of frames in the animation.

      • Frame2

        public Frame2(int x,
      int y,
      int w,
      int h,
      int frames)
        Creates a frame animation.
        Parameters:
        x - The X position of the animation.
        y - The Y position of the animation.
        w - The Width of the animation.
        h - The Height of the animation.
        frames - The amount of frames in the animation.

      • Frame2

        public Frame2(int x,
      int y,
      int w,
      int h,
      int frames,
      float frameLength)
        Creates a frame animation.
        Parameters:
        x - The X position of the animation.
        y - The Y position of the animation.
        w - The Width of the animation.
        h - The Height of the animation.
        frames - The amount of frames in the animation.
        frameLength - The length of each frame in the animation.

      • Frame2

        public Frame2(int x,
      int y,
      int w,
      int h,
      int frames,
      float frameLength,
      java.lang.String nextAnimation)
        Creates a frame animation.
        Parameters:
        x - The X position of the animation.
        y - The Y position of the animation.
        w - The Width of the animation.
        h - The Height of the animation.
        frames - The amount of frames in the animation.
        frameLength - The length of each frame in the animation.
        nextAnimation - The name of the next animation to play.
